sn17.12:1.3: When I’ve comprehended the mind of a certain person, I understand:
sn17.12:1.4: ‘This venerable would not tell a deliberate lie even for the sake of a silver bowl filled with gold powder.’
sn17.12:1.5: But some time later I see them tell a deliberate lie because their mind is overcome and overwhelmed by possessions, honor, and popularity.
sn17.12:1.6: So brutal are possessions, honor, and popularity. …”
